info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 11:19AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON... SOUTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND AND NORTHEASTERN FAYETTE COUNTIES THROUGH 1145 AM EDT... At 1118 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Perryopolis, or 10 miles northwest of Connellsville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Pleasant, Scottdale, Perryopolis, Calumet-Norvelt, Lynnwood-Pricedale, Everson, Fayette City, Allenport, Stockdale, Smithton, Dunlevy, and Dawson. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 42 and 49. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 79 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
